verses.kjv: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.ct: Then we turned and headed up the road toward Bashan. Og, the king of Bashan, marched out with his entire army to fight us at Edrei.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Fear him not: for I will deliver him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, 'Don't be afraid of him. I will give you victory over him, his entire army, and his land. Do to him exactly what you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.'

verses.kjv: So the LORD our God delivered into our hands Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
verses.ct: So the LORD our God also gave us victory over Og, king of Bashan, and his entire army. We struck them down until no one was left alive.

verses.kjv: And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.ct: We captured all of his cities at that time — there wasn't a single one we failed to take. In all, we seized 60 cities throughout the entire region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

verses.kjv: All these cities were fenced with high walls, gates, and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many.
verses.ct: All of these cities were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, in addition to a large number of unwalled villages.

verses.kjv: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.
verses.ct: We completely destroyed them, just as we had done to Sihon, king of Heshbon — wiping out the men, women, and children of every city.

verses.kjv: But all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.
verses.ct: But we kept all the livestock and the plunder from the cities for ourselves.

verses.kjv: And we took at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites the land that was on this side Jordan, from the river of Arnon unto mount Hermon;
verses.ct: At that time we took the territory from the 2 Amorite kings on the east side of the Jordan, stretching from the Arnon River all the way to Mount Hermon.

verses.kjv: (Which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion; and the Amorites call it Shenir;)
verses.ct: (The Sidonians call Hermon by the name Sirion, while the Amorites call it Shenir.)

verses.kjv: All the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salchah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.ct: This included all the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead, and all of Bashan as far as Salchah and Edrei — cities belonging to Og's kingdom in Bashan.

verses.kjv: For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in Rabbath of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.
verses.ct: Og, king of Bashan, was the last survivor of the giant Rephaim. His bed was made of iron — it can still be seen in Rabbah of the Ammonites. It measured about 13 and a half feet long and 6 feet wide, by standard measurement.

verses.kjv: And this land, which we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which is by the river Arnon, and half mount Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
verses.ct: From the territory we took possession of at that time, I gave the land from Aroer along the Arnon River, plus the southern half of the hill country of Gilead with its cities, to the tribes of Reuben and Gad.

verses.kjv: And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, being the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.
verses.ct: The rest of Gilead and all of Bashan — Og's kingdom — I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. The entire region of Argob throughout Bashan used to be known as the land of the Rephaim.

verses.kjv: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the country of Argob unto the coasts of Geshuri and Maachathi; and called them after his own name, Bashanhavothjair, unto this day.
verses.ct: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took the whole region of Argob as far as the borders of the Geshurites and the Maacathites. He named those settlements after himself — Havvoth-jair — and that name continues to this day.

verses.kjv: And I gave Gilead unto Machir.
verses.ct: I gave Gilead to Machir.

verses.kjv: And unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the river Arnon half the valley, and the border even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon;
verses.ct: To the tribes of Reuben and Gad, I assigned the territory from Gilead down to the Arnon River, with the middle of the valley as the boundary, and extending to the Jabbok River, which serves as the border with the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: The plain also, and Jordan, and the coast thereof, from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, under Ashdothpisgah eastward.
verses.ct: Their territory also included the Jordan Valley with the Jordan River as the western boundary, from Chinnereth all the way south to the Dead Sea, below the slopes of Pisgah on the east.

verses.kjv: And I commanded you at that time, saying, The LORD your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all that are meet for the war.
verses.ct: At that time I gave you this command: 'The LORD your God has granted you this land as your possession. But all your fighting men must cross over armed ahead of your fellow Israelites.

verses.kjv: But your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle, (for I know that ye have much cattle,) shall abide in your cities which I have given you;
verses.ct: Only your wives, your children, and your livestock — and I know you have large herds — will stay behind in the cities I have assigned to you.

verses.kjv: Until the LORD have given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and until they also possess the land which the LORD your God hath given them beyond Jordan: and then shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.
verses.ct: This will continue until the LORD gives your fellow Israelites rest, just as he has given you, and until they too have taken possession of the land the LORD your God is giving them across the Jordan. After that, each of you may return to the property I have given you.'

verses.kjv: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the LORD your God hath done unto these two kings: so shall the LORD do unto all the kingdoms whither thou passest.
verses.ct: I also instructed Joshua at that time, 'You have seen with your own eyes everything the LORD your God did to these 2 kings. The LORD will do the same to every kingdom you encounter as you cross over.'

verses.kjv: Ye shall not fear them: for the LORD your God he shall fight for you.
verses.ct: 'Don't be afraid of them, because the LORD your God is the one who fights for you.'

verses.kjv: And I besought the LORD at that time, saying,
verses.ct: At that time I pleaded with the LORD, saying,

verses.kjv: O Lord GOD, thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might?
verses.ct: 'Lord GOD, you have only begun to reveal your greatness and your mighty power to your servant. What god in heaven or on earth can match your deeds and your strength?

verses.kjv: I pray thee, let me go over, and see the good land that is beyond Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.
verses.ct: Please let me cross over and see the beautiful land on the other side of the Jordan — those magnificent hills and Lebanon.'

verses.kjv: But the LORD was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the LORD said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.
verses.ct: But the LORD was angry with me because of you and refused to listen to me. The LORD said to me, 'That's enough! Don't bring up this subject with me again.

verses.kjv: Get thee up into the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold it with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
verses.ct: Go up to the top of Pisgah and look out to the west, north, south, and east. Take it all in with your eyes, because you will not cross this Jordan.

verses.kjv: But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.
verses.ct: Instead, commission Joshua. Encourage him and strengthen him, because he is the one who will lead this people across and help them take possession of the land that you will only see from a distance.'

verses.kjv: So we abode in the valley over against Bethpeor.
verses.ct: So we stayed in the valley across from Beth-peor.
